pgTitle: List of African-American Medal of Honor recipients

"Voluntarily advanced with the head of the column and cut down the palisading."
Error: 1864 September 29 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
"Among the first to enter the enemy's works; although wounded."

"Took command of his company, all the officers having been killed or wounded, and gallantly led it."

0 Contraband "In international law, contraband is any goods carried by vessels of neutral nations during wartime that may be confiscated and thus prohibited from delivery to the enemy. Since slavery was still in active practice in the southern United States (the Confederate States of America) during the American Civil War when Blake was captured, he was considered someone's property and therefore considered to be contraband.”
Error: 1863 December 25 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

"[I]n an engagement with the enemy on John's Island. Serving the rifle gun, Blake, an escaped slave, carried out his duties bravely throughout the engagement which resulted in the enemy's abandonment of positions, leaving a caisson and one gun behind."
Error: 1864 September 29 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
"Took command of his company, all the officers having been killed or wounded, and gallantly led it."
Error: 1864 August 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1864 August 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

"Knocked unconscious into the hold of the ship when an enemy shellburst fatally wounded a man on the ladder above him, Brown, upon regaining consciousness, promptly returned to the shell whip on the berth deck and zealously continued to perform his duties although 4 of the 6 men at this station had been either killed or wounded by the enemy's terrific fire."
Battle of Fort Wagner, Morris Island
Error: 1863 July 18 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
"[G]rasped the flag, led the way to the parapet, and planted the colors thereon. When the troops fell back he brought off the flag, under a fierce fire in which he was twice severely wounded."
Error: 1864 July 30 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
"Planted his colors on the Confederate works in advance of his regiment, and when the regiment was driven back to the Union works he carried the colors there and bravely rallied the men."
Error: 1864 September 29 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
"Seized the colors, after 2 color bearers had been shot down, and bore them nobly through the fight."
Error: 1864 September 29 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
"Rushed in advance of his brigade, shot a rebel officer who was on the parapet rallying his men, and then ran him through with his bayonet."
Error: 1864 September 29 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1864 July 21 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1864 September 29 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
"When the regimental color bearer fell, this soldier seized the color and carried it forward, together with the national standard, until disabled at the enemy's inner line."
Error: 1864 September 29 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
"Took command of Company C, after all the officers had been killed or wounded, and gallantly led it."
Error: 1864 September 29 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
"Having had his arm mutilated, making immediate amputation necessary, he loaded and discharged his piece with one hand and urged his men forward; this within 30 yards of the enemy's works."
Error: 1864 September 29 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
"Gallantly seized the colors, which had fallen near the enemy's lines of abatis, raised them and rallied the men at a time of confusion and in a place of the greatest danger."
Error: 1864 August 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Although "Wounded in the leg and thrown violently against the side of the ship when an enemy shell killed or wounded the 6-man crew as the shell whipped on the berth deck, Lawson, upon regaining his composure, promptly returned to his station and, although urged to go below for treatment, steadfastly continued his duties..."
Error: 1864 August 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1864 June 19 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
"Acting as loader on the No. 2 gun during this bitter engagement, Pease exhibited marked coolness and good conduct and was highly recommended by the divisional officer for gallantry under fire."
Error: 1864 September 29 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
"Took command of his company after all the officers had been killed or wounded and gallantly led it in battle."
Error: 1864 September 29 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
"Commanded and gallantly led his company after the commanding officer had been killed; was the first enlisted man to enter the enemy's works."
Error: 1864 November 30 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
"Saving his regimental colors, after the color bearer was killed during al bloody charge called the Battle of Honey Hill, South Carolina"
Error: 1864 September 29 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
"Seized the national colors after 2 color bearers had been shot down close to the enemy's works, and bore them through the remainder of the battle."
